title: FCOR 599: Workshop Artifacts
text:
Home Page
Hey there,
This webpage contains workshop artifacts created by your FCOR 599 TA’s. Many of these artifacts were initially developed as workshops, and have been archived here for your reference. The topics range from cartography to advanced figure development and python scripting - most of which were requested by previous cohorts of your peers. If you have any questions, or have suggestions for additional modules that can be included here, please talk to your FCOR 599 teaching team.



ReuseCC BY 4.0

title: Cartography
text:
“All maps are lies, but some are useful” ~ Dr. Paul Pickell, circa 2020
Cartography is the art and science of creating, studying, and distributing maps and other visual representations of geographical areas. It involves a combination of scientific and artistic skills to communicate information about a place.



Eratosthenes’ World Map (220 BCE) showing the results of Alexander the Great’s conquests. Eratosthenes was the first geographer to include parallels and meridians in his maps, allowing for the calculation of distance.

title: The Art of Map Making
text: Lets add some text here about the history of maps. Some are very beautiful, some less so. Although we rightfully place emphasis on ensuring the scientific inegrity of maps, the artistic component of map making is a key component of science communication, and should not be overlooked.

title: ArcGIS Pro Demo
text: Insert a demo here that goes through the steps involved in making a beautiful map in ArcGIS Pro.
